business.headline: How taxes drove Formula 1 out of IndiaFormula 1 didn't leave India because of a lack of fans or infrastructure. It left because of unclear policies, tax confusion, and a system that didn't treat it like a sport.

Meta hires ChatGPT co-creator as chief scientist to lead new AI labMeta has appointed ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia Zhao as chief scientist of its new Superintelligence Lab, aiming to advance AGI and regain AI leadership after Llama 4's weak performance.

Explained: Why India-UK free trade agreement is a big deal for both nationsIndia and the United Kingdom have formally sealed a Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, a deal described as the "biggest, most economically significant trade deal that the UK has made since leaving the EU."

Not a shareholder, no coercion: Sunjay Kapur's firm counters mother's chargesThe clarification comes after it was reported that Rani Kapur had written a letter to delay the AGM and alleged that she was made to sign documents shortly after her son's death.

Remainers will choke on their cornflakes: British media hails India trade dealThe India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) or the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) seeks to enhance bilateral trade by around USD 34 billion annually, besides ensuring better market access.

FTAs with EU, US in talks, says Commerce Secretary after India-UK trade dealThe agreement now needs to pass through both houses of the British Parliament. A special committee will study it before giving final approval.

Everyone wants to be an influencer. But can it pay the bills?The creator economy in India is booming, but the economics remain shaky. What started as a hobby or side hustle for many is now a full-time hustle, and an increasingly competitive one.

Sensex ends 721 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; Bajaj Finance falls 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 721.08 points to 81,463.09 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 225.10 points to trade at 24,837.

Sunjay Kapur's mother alleges business coercion, attempt to 'usurp family legacy'Rani Kapur has publicly objected to what she calls an "inappropriate and premature" AGM, held during a period of deep mourning, and raised serious concerns over how decisions are being made in the aftermath.

This key agreement in UK trade deal will hugely benefit Indian firms, workersOne of the key parts of the India-UK trade deal is the introduction of the Double Contribution Convention (DCC), which is expected to help Indian professionals working in the UK by reducing their social security burden.

Filing ITR under old regime? Claim these 5 home loan tax benefits If you are sticking to the old tax regime this year, make sure you don't miss out on the big tax savings your home loan can offer. Here are five home loan benefits you must know for your ITR.

entertainment.headline: Kajol opens up on cosmetic surgery, says it's a personal choice not to be judgedActor Kajol opened up about cosmetic surgery and aging, calling both personal choices that shouldn't be judged. She said aging is a privilege and not something to fear, adding that men also undergo cosmetic procedures just like women.

Pak TikToker found dead, daughter claims she was poisoned for refusing marriagePakistani TikToker Sumeera Rajput was found dead under suspicious circumstances in Sindh's Ghotki district, with her daughter alleging she was poisoned over pressure to marry forcibly. Two suspects have been arrested, but the motive remains unconfirmed as investigations continue.

Zareen Khan slams trolls for age-shaming: Will marriage make me young again?Actor Zareen Khan gave a sharp and witty response to an ageist troll who told her to get married because she's getting old. She questioned the mindset of people behind their words.

Smriti Irani, Ektaa Kapoor to visit Nathdwara temple ahead of Kyunki rebootSmriti Irani and Ektaa Kapoor will visit Nathdwara Temple in Rajasthan on July 27 to seek blessings ahead of the premiere of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' Season 2.

Thalaivan Thalaivii box office Day 1: Vijay Sethupathi's film earns Rs 4.15 crorePandiraj's Thalaivan Thalaivii, featuring Vijay Sethupathi and Nithya Menen, opened to an encouraging start at the box office, earning Rs 4.15 crore on day one.

Smriti Irani shares Miss India connection with Gauri Pradhan ahead of Kyunki 2Actor-politician Smriti Irani shared that she and Gauri Pradhan were Miss India finalists in 1998, long before becoming the iconic saas-bahu duo in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi'.

Malayalam producer files nomination in burqa after legal battle with film chamberMalayalam producer Sandra Thomas filed her nomination papers in a burqa amid a legal battle with the Kerala Film Producers Association (KFPA).
Akshay Kumar returns to ramp as showstopper after 12 years. WatchAkshay Kumar made a grand return to the ramp after 12 years as the showstopper for Falguni Shane Peacock at India Couture Week 2025.

SEVENTEEN's Joshua breathes new life into Slander's Love Is GoneSEVENTEEN's Joshua brings a heartfelt new twist to Love Is Gone with American DJs SLANDER, showcasing his unique vocal tone. This collaboration marks another step in his growing global music journey as SEVENTEEN gears up for their world tour.

Diljit distributes sweets as he wraps Border 2, Varun Dhawan, Ahan Shetty reactDiljit Dosanjh has wrapped the shooting of his upcoming film 'Border 2'. In a video shared by the singer-turned-actor, he distributed sweets on the sets.

Is Farah Khan against 8-hour shifts? Director reacts to ongoing buzzFilmmaker Farah Khan has hinted that she doesn't support the idea of an eight-hour workday in the film industry. Her remark comes amid the ongoing debate sparked by Deepika Padukone's reported exit from Spirit over work-hour demands.

Akshay Kumar confirms return of Hera Pheri trio, says announcement coming soonAkshay Kumar has confirmed that all issues around 'Hera Pheri 3' have been resolved and the original team is reuniting. He assured fans that an official announcement would be made soon.

Akshay Kumar praises Ahaan-Aneet after Saiyaara success, welcomes them to industryAkshay Kumar shared his appreciation for 'Saiyaara'. The actor congratulated the entire team and praised newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda.

Mallika Sherawat reacts to mandali singing Bheege Honth in Mumbai local. WatchActor Mallika Sherawat shared a viral video of a bhajan mandali singing her iconic song 'Bheege Honth Tere' from 'Murder' inside a Mumbai local.

Curious case of missing dance from dance numbers - no choreography, only clickbaitOnce driven by choreography, dance numbers now rely on their potential to go viral. Industry insiders, including actors, directors, trade analysts, and choreographers, weigh in.

Ektaa Kapoor denies association with ALTT amid ban for vulgar contentTV Czarina Ektaa Kapoor denied her association with ALTT after the government banned the app for vulgar content. Kapoor stated that she had stepped down from her association with the app in June 2021.

Fantastic Four box office Day 1: Marvel film earns Rs 5 crore amid Saiyaara crazeMarvel Studios' 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' opened modestly in India, earning Rs 5.10 crore on its first day, facing stiff competition from the Bollywood hit 'Saiyaara'.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 2: Pawan Kalyan's film sees a huge dipPawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' saw a sharp decline at the box office on its second day, earning Rs 8 crore after an impressive Rs 47.50 crore opening.

Saiyaara box office Day 8: Mohit Suri film continues strong run, earns Rs 190 croreMohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' has been earning tremendous love from all quarters. The movie, starring debutant Ahaan Panday alongside Aneet Padda, earned Rs 190 crore in just eight days.

general news.headline: Thailand, Cambodia agree to hold immediate ceasefire talks: TrumpTrump said Thailand and Cambodia agreed to hold immediate ceasefire talks after deadly border clashes. Both sides seek peace, while regional and international efforts push for a long-term resolution.

Odisha cancels Bhubaneswar metro project, Naveen Patnaik calls it shockingThe Biju Janata Dal (BJD) chief dropped a scathing post on social media criticising Odisha's Mohan Charan Manjhi government for calling off a contract with the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC).

Rudra brigades, Bhairav battalions to boost Army's capabilities in border areasWhile fighting components like the infantry, mechanised infantry, armoured units, artillery, special forces, and unmanned aerial systems have been integrated under Rudra, Bhairav Light Commando Battalions have been established to shock the enemy on the border.

Air India releases Rs 25 lakh interim aid to families of 166 crash victimsThe airline also confirmed that the requisite documents of 52 more deceased passengers have been verified and compensation for their families will be disbursed shortly.

Power, pollution, politics: The great hypocrisy of India's VIP cavalcadeIndia's political and administrative leaders routinely travel in massive, fuel-hungry cavalcades — fleets whose carbon footprints are far larger than they appear in passing. The cavalcades in Indian are seen as a symbol of power, reach and position.

Centre orders safety audits in schools after 7 killed in Rajasthan roof collapseThe directive requires schools to assess not only structural and fire safety but also take into account students' mental well-being and establish a reporting mechanism for safety concerns.

India show spine as gritty Shubman Gill, KL Rahul drag Manchester Test into Day 5Defiant Shubman Gill and KL Rahul led India's fightback on Day 4 of the fourth Test against England at Old Trafford in Manchester. India finished the day on 174/2, trailing England by 137 runs in the second innings.

Revamp tensions in BJP-RSS: Why the Sangh stamp is all overThe RSS is no longer content playing second fiddle. It is not just shaping state appointments in the BJP but also the central leadership transition

Sachin's debut was before I was born, grew up trying to be like him: RootJoe Root, now the second-highest run-scorer in the history of Test cricket, has paid a heartfelt tribute to all-time leading run-scorer Sachin Tendulkar, saying he grew up trying to emulate the Indian legend.

UK deal gold standard for trade negotiations with other partners: Piyush GoyalHighlighting the global significance of the agreement, Piyush Goyal asserted that the FTA reflects India's growing relevance on the world stage.

Mudslinging by BJP: Gaurav Gogoi on Himanta Sarma's ISI links' claims on his wifeCongress MP Gaurav Gogoi has rubbished allegations and claims that his wife, Elizabeth Colburn, has links with Pakistani intelligence agency ISI, saying the BJP has a habit of defaming people and mud-slinging and accused the party of running a "smear campaign".

Tej Pratap Yadav to fight as independent months after RJD expelled himThis came just days after he said in an exclusive conversation with India Today TV that he would contest from the Mahua Assembly constituency as an independent candidate if he was not given an RJD ticket.

Curious case of missing dance from dance numbers - no choreography, only clickbaitOnce driven by choreography, dance numbers now rely on their potential to go viral. Industry insiders, including actors, directors, trade analysts, and choreographers, weigh in.

Asia Cup 2025 full schedule: India vs Pakistan on September 14, final on 28Asia Cup 2025: India and Pakistan are scheduled to meet in the group-stage match on September 14. The Asian rivals can meet again in the Super Four stage. A total of six teams will compete in the continental tournament, which will be held in the UAE from September 9 to 28.

Pak TikToker found dead, daughter claims she was poisoned for refusing marriagePakistani TikToker Sumeera Rajput was found dead under suspicious circumstances in Sindh's Ghotki district, with her daughter alleging she was poisoned over pressure to marry forcibly. Two suspects have been arrested, but the motive remains unconfirmed as investigations continue.

There's still hope: Delhi's old vehicle ban to be reviewed by Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court will hear a pivotal plea on July 28 that could overturn Delhi's controversial ban on older vehicles, offering hope to old vehicle owners facing unfair and non-scientific, end-of-life restrictions.

How an India-US spy mission lost a nuclear device in the HimalayasAfter China's first atomic test, the US and India, as part of a covert operation, tried to place a nuclear-powered listening device at 25,000 feet in the Himalayas near the Nanda Devi peak. A blizzard forced the CIA-IB team to leave the device on the route. A recovery mission, and several search operations, failed to locate the device.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

NCERT to add special module on Operation Sindoor in curriculum for higher classesNCERT is creating a special classroom module for higher classes on Operation Sindoor, India's May 7 counter-strike after the Pahalgam terror attack. This is currently in the last stages of development and is expected to be released soon.

Labubus of the world unite, but not at Karl Marx's graveIn a capitalism-dominated world, where superficiality sells and sincerity scrolls by unnoticed, it took a designer Labubu doll to make a handwritten letter left at German philosopher Karl Marx's grave go viral. The irony is even Marx's grave hasn't gone untouched by consumerism.

Bihar woman gang-raped in moving ambulance after fainting in Home Guard examThe incident occurred on July 24, after the woman fainted during a race and was rushed to a hospital in an ambulance stationed at the site.

Historic free trade deal with UK shows world's trust in India: PM in Tamil NaduReturning from the Maldives after his official visit, Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a rally in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin and said the India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) was historic and showed the world's trust in the country.

Koneru Humpy, Divya Deshmukh play out a draw in Game 1 of the finalIndia's Koneru Humpy and Divya Deshmukh played out a tense, high-quality draw in Game 1 of the FIDE Women's World Cup final in Batumi, Georgia, on Saturday.

Legal aid clinic set up in Nagaland for soldiers, ex-servicemen and their familiesThe inauguration was part of the national launch of the NALSA Veer Parivar Sahayata Yojana - 2025, a flagship programme committed to ensuring legal support to the armed forces.

She said aging is a privilege and not something to fear, adding that men also undergo cosmetic procedures just like women.
Samantha Ruth Prabhu charms in yellow as she arrives in Mumbai. VideoSamantha Ruth Prabhu was seen at Mumbai airport on Saturday afternoon.

sports.headline: Rishabh Pant will bat for India on Day 5 in Manchester, confirms batting coachIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak has confirmed that wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant will bat on Day 5 of the fourth Test against England at Old Trafford in Manchester. Pant suffered a toe fracture on Day 1 of the Test.

India show spine as gritty Shubman Gill, KL Rahul drag Manchester Test into Day 5Defiant Shubman Gill and KL Rahul led India's fightback on Day 4 of the fourth Test against England at Old Trafford in Manchester. India finished the day on 174/2, trailing England by 137 runs in the second innings.

Virat Kohli's brother takes dig at India's bowling flop show in Manchester TestIndia vs England, 4th Test: Virat Kohli's brother, Vikas Kohli, lamented the lack of firepower in India's bowling performance during the Manchester Test, contrasting it with the success the bowling unit enjoyed just a few years ago. India conceded 669 runs to England in the first innings of the fourth Test of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

China Open: Satwiksairaj, Chirag Shetty lose to familiar foes in semifinalsSatwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty were defeated by Aaron Chia and Soh Wooi Yik i the semi-finals of the China Open. The loss continues their title drought as they continue to struggle against the second-ranked Malaysian pair.

New Zealand clinch thriller, seal T20 tri-series title vs South AfricaMatt Henry held his nerve in the final over to guide New Zealand to a nail-biting three-run win over South Africa in the final of the T20 tri-series at the Harare Sports Club on Saturday.

Jasprit Bumrah's action hard to sustain, but keeps delivering: Kapil DevENG vs IND: Kapil Dev was understanding of Jasprit Bumrah's injury struggles in the past and attributed it to his awkward action which also remains his biggest advantage when it comes to bowling across all three formats.

Jasprit Bumrah concedes 100-plus in an innings, ends 47-Test match streakEngland vs India: Jasprit Bumrah bowled 33 overs and conceded 112 runs in the first innings of the Manchester Test. Bumrah struggled for rhythm, suffering a niggle on Day 3 at Old Trafford.

The Asian rivals can meet again in the Super Four stage. A total of six teams will compete in the continental tournament, which will be held in the UAE from September 9 to 28.

Player agency sues Nitish Reddy over unpaid dues of Rs 5 croreIndia all-rounder Nitish Reddy is facing legal action from his former player agency. The case has been filed over alleged unpaid dues from the player to his former agency.

Koneru Humpy, Divya Deshmukh play out a draw in Game 1 of the finalIndia's Koneru Humpy and Divya Deshmukh played out a tense, high-quality draw in Game 1 of the FIDE Women's World Cup final in Batumi, Georgia, on Saturday.

The Asian rivals can meet again in the Super Four stage. A total of six teams will compete in the continental tournament, which will be held in the UAE from September 9 to 28.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
